author: @accidentreport
title: Parts Of Midwest Brace For Ice; Michigan First Responders Dash To Safety During Major Crash - Nationwide
text:
[Parts of Midwest brace for ice; Michigan first responders dash to safety during major crash ](https://kstp.com/kstp-news/regional/parts-of-midwest-brace-for-ice-michigan-first-responders-dash-to-safety-during-major-crash/)
Freezing rain is expected in parts of the U.S. Midwest, especially Iowa. In addition, forecasters are warning about a possible ice storm this weekend in one section of the state. The National Weather Service says ice — combined with strong wind — could be significant enough to bring down power lines and damage trees in Waterloo and Cedar Rapids. Nebraska’s largest city, Omaha, is bracing for freezing rain. In Michigan, there were no serious injuries when a box truck lost control on an icy highway and smashed into emergency vehicles Thursday.
Continue reading this story from the [source](https://kstp.com/kstp-news/regional/parts-of-midwest-brace-for-ice-michigan-first-responders-dash-to-safety-during-major-crash/).
